page.title: 14ST.NICHOLAS'CHURCH & ABBEY.
page.content: ST. NICHOLAS'CHURCH and the ABBEY RUINS.{St.Nicholas'Church,}known as the "Parish Church" is a fine old red sandstone building{dating back}to {Norman times}as may be seen from the style of archtecture.{Standing}in the {Abbey Fields}the{church}has a most {beautiful aspect}and is well worth a visit as most discerning tourists will testify.{Adjacent}to the{church}are the{remains}of the{Abbey}last {excavated}many years ago. Sadly most of those{excavations}were{covered in when the{Fields}underwent some {landscape improvement}work on completion of the dig!{Today}the only {remaining parts}are a tall section of the{Cloister wall}and the{Infirmary. The{Kenilworth History and Archaeology {Society}use the building to store various artifacts there and it is{open to the{public}occasionally.
